definition: layman

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
outside/in addition/foreign/external
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
man

sentences.english: You are a layman in the field of oceanology.
sentences.chinese: 你在海洋學方面是個門外漢。

sentences.english: To the uninitiated, this approach may sound little better than guesswork.
sentences.chinese: 對於門外漢，這種方法聽起來比猜測好不了多少。

sentences.english: He cannot pose any more as the disgruntled outsider.
sentences.chinese: 他再也不能把自己當作一個氣哼哼的門外漢了。

sentences.english: Bi- metal foil is strongly recommended for quick authentication by the layman.
sentences.chinese: 雙金屬箔強烈建議快速驗證的門外漢。

sentences.english: If satisfied Shanseng see Office Solutions Direct Rao know Dayton forget, still a layman.
sentences.chinese: 若納山僧見處，直饒知解頓忘，猶是門外漢。

sentences.english: More than any other detail of biohacking, this is the one that laymen grasp.
sentences.chinese: 無需更多說明，下面就是一個門外漢的所作所爲。

sentences.english: He always modestly calls himself a laymen in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他總是謙稱自己是書法藝術的門外漢。

sentences.english: The committee， headed by a layman， resigned in protest.
sentences.chinese: 由門外漢率領的該委員會在鄭重聲明中辭職。

definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
specious arguments/sophistry
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to be at a loss for words/speechless
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to persist in one's views
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
irrelevant/beside the point
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
